direction.raw_text: .A. Screenplay by John Carpenter
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pounding, metallic beat begins. Twists of sound in a tightrope rhythm. The snap of a military snare drum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : "1998" FEMALE NARRATOR Forces hostile to the United States grow strong in the late 20th Century.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CITY STREET - LOS ANGELES - NIGHT Graffiti-smeared walls. Fires raging. Automatic weapons fire. Shadowy figures dash through the southern California night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A great moral crisis grips the nation as social revolution and a breakdown of the criminal justice system threaten society.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stand like sentinels. Black uniforms. Battle helmets. Gleaming military assault weapons. Bullet-proof shields with large emblems: the American eagle against a red background, and in bold letters underneath, "THE UNITED STATES POLICE FORCE".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To protect and defend its citizens, the United States Police Force is formed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of Los Angeles, on the coast of southern California.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : "1999" FEMALE NARRATOR The population of Los Angeles grows to 40 million. The city is ravaged by crime and immorality. A Presidential candidate predicts a millennium earthquake will destroy the city in divine retribution. The map of L.A. now glows a dark red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hot summer's day. Heat ripples distorts the towering shadowing buildings in the dense smog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An earthquake measuring 9.6 on the Richter scale hits at 12:59 p.m., August 23rd, in the year 2000. Suddenly we are hit by the loudest, booming, rolling concussion you have ever heard. The buildings begin to shake, swaying wildly. The Bonaventure Hotel implodes, collapses inward in the thudding, slamming freight train of an earthquake. The 4-level Interchange as the Santa Monica Freeway shatters, crumbles, pulling exit ramps, cars, trees, and nearby buildings with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buildings shaking. Streets buckling. Cars rolling, crashing. People running. Gas mains exploding. Buildings convulsing and dropping like tinder against an inferno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the tsunami sweeps in from the ocean, smacking into the shoreline like the hammer of God, plunging us into darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After the devastation, the constitution is damned, and the newly elected President accepts a lifetime term of office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of the United States. A line tracks along the Mexican border, like the Berlin Wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fearing a massive terrorist invasion from South America, the United States prepares for war. The Great Wall is built along the southern border, cutting off the flow of illegal aliens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ruins of L.A. Rubble, smoke, a lethal wasteland. An army of terrifying figures climbs atop a mountain of debris. They raise their weapons into the night sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Street gangs, South American terrorists and the criminally insane capture Los Angeles, the once-great City of Angels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .A An unrecognizable L.A. After the big one. Surrounded by water, L.A. is now an island off the new western shore, tilting on the edge of the continental plate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now an island on the border of civilization, L.A. is a no-man's land of chaos, anarchy and darkness. A red line tracks along the mountainous areas surrounding the island, defining the perimeter of the armed fortress. Police firebases and gun emplacements are indicated in the San Gabriel Mountains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The United States Police Force, like an army, is encamped in the San Gabriel Mountains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: INTO L.A. From the glowing, outlined canyons come the cries of rage of a million lost souls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The President's first act as Permanent Commander-in-Chief is Directive 17: protect and defend the United States from this island of the damned, Hell on Earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : "2013 - NOW" EXT. DARK OCEAN - NIGHT TRAVELING SHOT low, across the top of the water's surface. Climb up the side of a massive, rusted supertanker, abandoned, years ago. Break over the railing to reveal a gigantic neon sign which screams "NEW LAS VEGAS." The supertanker has been transformed into a floating resort. The camera increases speed, moves past huge billboards displaying gigantic glitzy ads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - an extravaganza with fabulous showgirls and laser recreations of Fidel's final night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - a virtual reality tour featuring legendary Vegas entertainers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - a virtual Disneyland for the whole family. Now camera flies low through glittering streets and back alleyways filled with gamblers, neon and glitz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An alley strangled with tourists, gamblers, hookers, hustlers, and con men - professional expatriates from the West mingling with excited visitors from all over the world.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: "NEW LAS VEGAS OFF THE COAST OF SEATTLE THURSDAY 0330 HOURS G

direction.raw_text: : "NEW LAS VEGAS OFF THE COAST OF SEATTLE THURSDAY 0330 HOURS G.M.T. " A Salesman with a chin-mike speaks non-stop, unintelligible Chinese. A frenzied crowd gathers around him, waving money, placing bets. Two men sit at either end of a long table. They are in deep shadows, facing each other. We only get glimpses of them: One fat. Mirrored sunglasses. Chinese. His fingers tap on the table. A cockroach scurries past. Ammo belts. A sheathed combat knife the size of your arm. .45 automatics in holsters. The other, dressed in black. An eye-patch. Dangerous. A flash of two six-guns in holsters. A futuristic gunfighter. The cockroach dashes past his fingers. WHAP! He squashes it. The crowd goes nuts, placing bets, yelling and screaming in a dozen languages. The salesman places three different shaped, clear shot glasses in front of the two men. Then he leans over to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He reaches in, grabs a cobra, pulls it out. The cobra hisses and squirms. Deftly, the salesman continues to talk non-stop into his chin-mike as he milks the cobra venom into the first glass. He pulls out an ice-pick, jabs it into the snake's throat, and bleeds a thick green-white liquid into the second glass. Finally, he slits open the cobra with a large knife, and cuts out the heart and liver. Tossing aside the dead snake, the salesman squeezes the heart and liver with his fingers. The juice drips into the third glass. Now the salesman stirs the glasses. The poison is clear. The blood is milky-green. The heart and liver are red. He places the glasses on the table between the two men. The two men stare at each other, motionless. The crowd continues placing bets at a fevered pitch. A titanium white tube floats above the center of the table. A laser beam of light shines from one end. The salesman leans over and flicks on side with his finger, sending the tube spinning on its axis like a bottle, the light circling the room before stopping on the fat man's forehead. The fat man reaches slowly toward the glasses. His hand shakes slightly. He hesitates. Finally he takes the glass with the red liquid (the heart and liver), lifts it to his lips, pauses, then gulps it down. The crowd explodes. More bets. The salesman leans over and spins the light tube again, this time it lands on something black, an eye-patch. Pull back to reveal a man with an eye-patch. The man with the eye-patch reaches forward, his hand paused between the remaining two glasses. He takes the one filled with milky-green blood and downs it fast. The crowd roars. One glass left. The two men stare at it intently. The salesman spins the light tube with more force than before. It circles again and again, slowing down, speeding up, finally stopping on the fat man. The salesman begins yelling over the din of the crowd, shouting at the fat man. The fat man reaches for the glass of clear poison. His trembling fingers hover above it. Then he quickly withdraws his hand. The crowd reacts, boos, as... The man with the eye-patch smiles. A slightly, cynical smile. And without hesitation, he reaches out, grabs the glass of poison, and drinks it down. The crowd surges forward, but the salesman stops them with a sweep of his arm. All bets are off. The two men stand from the table. Take several steps away toward the end of the alley. Stand facing each other. Two gunfighters. Flashes of the two men. A piece of a black military boot. A hand positioned over a six-shooter. Mirrored sunglasses. A sweaty, trembling lip. And the eye-patched man's one good eye, blue and clear, staring - hard and calm as a sunny day... The draw. It happens in an instant. The alley thunders with gunfire. The guns buck and flash. Then silence. The two men stand there for a beat, until one of them, the fat man, slumps, falls face first into the alley, dead. The crowd goes completely ape shit as SNAKE PLISSKEN emerges from the shadows of the alley, holsters his guns, grabs his take of the money...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Long hair. A black eye-patch. A tight-lipped grimace. The impression of coiled aggression and intense cynicism. The toughest, most dangerous man on planet earth. A legend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: strolls out of the alley into the crowd. He counts his money, pockets it, as a cigarette girl approaches him. PLISSKEN stops her, pays for a pack of cigs. As she eyes him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... the cigarette girl touches him, pricks his skin with her fingernail. A drop of blood appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns, stares after her, as the sound of helicopters rises from above in the night sky. The crowd suddenly starts to disperse. Helicopter searchlights blast down on the street. PLISSKEN is suddenly caught in the glare. He starts to move away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Out of the blackness above a huge steel net drops out of nowhere. The net slams down on top of PLISSKEN, trapping him, driving him down to the pavement with its weight... PLISSKEN struggles inside the net as black figures - United States Police Force Officers - rush toward him, grab the net, tightening it. More cops move for him as we SLOWLY FADE TO BLACK...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : "L.A. FRIDAY 1900 HOURS" EXT. CONTAINMENT WALL - FIREBASE SEVEN - L.A. - NIGHT Searchlights sweep down across a column of policemen marching past a concrete wall. Camera begins to crane up the wall. Sound of roaring turbines. The howl of the Santa Ana wind. Camera reaches the top of the wall. Armed police troops stand on the battlements. Across what looks like an ocean is L.A. The view is from the Newhall Pass. Hidden by the Santa Monica Mountains, L.A. glows in the distance with a hundred fires. Smoke surges from the jagged horizon. Above, the sky is an angry orange.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Res sensor lights glow in evenly spaced intervals. Searchlights sweep into the darkness. Cannons are in place every 200 feet, manned by police guards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Water stretches into blackness. This was once the San Fernando Valley, but now it's all underwater. Pieces of debris - tops of buildings, the tail of an airplane, a radio tower - stick up above the surface. We can make out the letters of an old, half-sunken sign: "SAN FERNANDO VALLEY MALL" EXT. THE WALL - NIGHT The wall stretches to the northwest up to the Santa Susanna Pass. Portions of the 118 Freeway arch up out of the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Firebase Seven is a fortified base camp in the San Gabriel Mountains. It is a sprawling police complex with low concrete bunkers, gun emplacements, satellite communications, vehicles, troops, the works. ON A LARGE ASPHALT FIELD, opposite the main complex is Rotor City - row after row of black, multi-bladed, totally evil police battle helicopters parked like giant bugs on the ground. A throng of policemen gather at the edge of Rotor City yelling and cheering, their fists in the air. Cops with camcorders videotape the event. A police anchor reports...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's been the Force's Most Wanted Man for
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: years. Convicted of 27 moral crimes. I can tell you, the excitement around here is... (a great roaring skyward) Here he comes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes slamming down out of the black sky and lands. The growing crowd of cheering cops goes nuts like fans at a football game. They slap hands, dance wildly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mammoth room filled with high-tech instrumentation. A glowing holographic map of L.A. fills one wall. Most of the control personnel have left their work stations and gather around TV sets all showing the Police Channel: a view of the helicopter transport sitting on the asphalt and the cheering crowds at the edge of Rotor City. A tall, steel-faced officer sits at his desk. This is Firebase Commander MAC "BIG DOG" MALLOY. Hard, battle weary features.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a section Lieutenant, comes up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Commander Malloy. They're bringing him out, sir. Malloy rises from his chair, steps to a nearby TV set, watches the scene from the Police Channel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we finally got him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd of cops is growing to a frenzy of wild anticipation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold one! The door is opening! The door of the helicopter transport slowly lowers like a drawbridge. Out of its black belly comes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A steel collar is clamped around his neck. Eight lengths of chain stretch to eight armed guards who escort Plissken down the ramp. Plissken is bruised, badly beaten and tortured, his face a mess, but he doesn't seem to care. A line of battle-ready cops stand with their guns aimed right at Plissken's head as he is marched into camp. An army of camcorders move ahead of the Police Anchor as he scampers along in front of PLISSKEN, interviewing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Plissken. Welcome to L.A. Celebrating cops cheer as Plissken is lead to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DEPORTATION CENTER The bunker has one large opening, into which hundreds of deportees march. Guards in towers monitor the condemned as they trudge out of fenced-in containment areas, down walled corridors to the bunker entrance. The deportees are minorities, the poor, prostitutes, pimps, thieves, adulterers, atheists - the Morally Guilty, outcasts of society. Single mothers carry babies. Teenage runaways huddle together. There are abortion doctors, drug dealers, pornographers, the prisoners of a massive cultural war. As Plissken is marched toward the entrance, a loudspeaker blares out:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A SIGN ABOVE A CONCRETE BUNKER

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) You are now entering the Deportation Center. You have been found guilty of moral crimes against the United States of America. A great cheer goes up from the cops as the Police Anchor conducts his interview...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .D. Bob Plissken. Special Forces, Black Light, Texas Thunder. Two Purple Hearts. Youngest man ever decorated by the President. Plissken's face remains so impassive as to be almost blank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A glowing, vaporous-orange corridor. More cops gather to watch Plissken as he is escorted into the bowels of the Deportation Center.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've been convicted of 27 moral crimes, Plissken. The murder of an Internal Revenue agent. The kidnapping of a bank president. Gun fighting for profit. The list goes on and on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deeper into the Deportation Center. Camera tracks along the deportees, some bleeding, some wrapped in rags. Plissken, the Police Anchor, camcorders and the armed escort move through the dark, low concrete passageway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You used to respect the law. Served your country like no man before you. Role model to a generation. The Police Anchor leans in as close as he dares to Plissken's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to you, war hero? You were the best we had.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DEPORTATION CENTER - NIGHT Steel walls. Deeper into the Deportation Center. The deportees here are in worse shape. Some appear to be dead. Plissken and his entourage continue along, as the speaker echoes a pre-recorded message...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) You are sentenced to permanent expulsion beyond the borders of the U.S. You now have the option to repent of your sins and be electrocuted on the premises. If you elect this option, notify the Cleric Sergeant in your Processing Area. Plissken and his entourage pass deportees kneeling and praying in front of cloaked cleric cops, government holy men. Beyond, through opened doorways, see Death Row deportees being strapped into futuristic electric chairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The whole world's watching. Every good and decent person who works and hard and follows the rules. What would say to them? Plissken's expression is blank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What would you say to all of us who believed in you, who looked up to you, who thought you stood for right over wrong, good over evil? Be my guest. What do you have to say, Plissken?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) Call me Snake. The guards move Plissken through a doorway, and the huge steel doors slam shut on the Police Anchor and the camcorders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Malloy, Brazen, and a 3rd man, tall, charismatic, grim, move urgently along a corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ComStat did a psychosearch on him. Used a database of 5 million sociopathic personalities. He hit the bottom of the curve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perfect for the mission. Nobody else can pull it off - not an army, not a man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zero emotional developments. Total lack of compassion. A highly developed psychopathic instinct to survive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get this over with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cell door slams shut. Plissken turns around. Writ and leg irons. He looks around. In the concrete cell he sees a simple table with an overhead light above it. A watch lies on the table. Plissken shuffles over, picks up the watch, examines it. The cell door opens. Malloy, Brazen, and the 3rd Man enter the room unarmed. The door closes. Malloy and Brazen move forward, to the edge of the light. The 3rd Man stays back in the shadows by the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How you doin' Plissken? (no reply) You like the watch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You assholes didn't bring me here to give me this for 20 years of dedicated service. What'ya want? Malloy looks back to the 3rd Man in the shadows...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get to it. Malloy raises a control unit, pushes the button. The lights go down and a computer-enhanced image appears on the wall...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the point of view of a surveillance camera. The lab is huge. Banks of processors, disk drives, test bays, prototype assembly areas. High tech. A group of government officials is being given a tour. Utopia, 17, the President's daughter is among them. Pretty, virginal, she wears a "True Love Waits" button on her flowered dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At 1030 hours Wednesday, a group of government officials began a tour of the Livermore Defense Lab. The President's daughter, Utopia, was among them. Plissken continues to watch the image on the wall...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An hour later, she boarded Air Force 3 to Washington. The 3rd Man reacts as the image in front of Plissken changes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the point of view of a camcorder. Utopia stands inside the main cabin of a plush, government 747. In one hand she holds a black anodized box the size of a transistor radio with a button on top. In the other, a machine gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the camcorder) To the American people - it is time to rise up and demand the surrender of the President and his corrupt theocracy of lies and terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At 1140 hours, she hijacked the plane. We scanned the videotape on VR. Check it out. Inside the surveillance room the President stares grimly as Malloy presses a button. Suddenly the image in front of Plissken spreads out all around him. He is in a virtual reality re-creation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken stands manacled in the main cabin. A group of secret service men and congressmen watch as a flight attendance operates a camcorder. He's videotaping Utopia as she rants into the camera. She's pent up with such anxiety she's like a panther in a cage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Today is Day One of a brand new world. The days of the empire are finished. (beat) To the President - my father, you know what this is. She holds up the anodized box with the red button and thrusts it at the camcorder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what it will do. Unless you abdicate your throne by tomorrow night, I will use it - on you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Utopia, please. Give us the prototype. If something should happen -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It will be in my hands - and the hands of my lover. She says "lover" with all the drama a 17-year-old virgin can muster. The others are shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, my lover. My man. The only real man I've ever known. I'm on my way to his arms. She moves to the rear of the main cabin, bends down, opens a small hatch in the floor, scrambles down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The VR image suddenly disappears and Plissken is again standing inside the concrete cell. Malloy and Brazen stand in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somehow during the tour, she came into possession of a prototype transmitting device. We don't know how.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Utopia became depressed after her mother's suicide, began to withdraw into her virtual reality simulator. She'd punch up her own little world in cyberspace and stay in it for days at a time. (hits a button) Somebody else was in there with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In front of Plissken: A computer-rendered VR picture of clouds and sunshine, green grass and happy animals frolicking. A Garden of Eden. There, coming toward us, is CUERVO JONES. South American terrorist. Fiercest warrior of the Third World. He wears a gleaming ancient Aztec battle helmet. Bandoliers strapped around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cuervo Jones. Shining Path. Peruvian terrorist. Runs the biggest baddest gang in L.A. Cuervo Jones takes off the helmet He is blindingly handsome, charismatic. He smiles, reaches out his arms to camera as if to embrace it. The image suddenly pops back to the beginning - it's on a loop. The image disappears. The lights in the cell come up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Utopia made tapes of her VR experiences, then tried to erase them. She missed this fragment on the end of her last tape. Cuervo Jones must have tapped into the VR master data bank - and then went prowling around for innocent blood, someone vulnerable to corrupt. Utopia was lonely, looking for something to believe in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sad story. You got a cigarette?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, Plissken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the little black box do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Top secret. Only on a need to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I don't need to know. So fuck you, I'm goin' to Hollywood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, big shot. Unless you do what we want you're not coming back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's the deal, huh? Go into L.A., find the President's daughter, secure the box, and bring 'em both out - and I'm free?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell the President to adopt. I think I'll like L.A. After a couple of beats, the 3rd Man appears next to Malloy and Brazen. He stares at Plissken for a moment, holds up some papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you bring out the prototype, you'll receive a full pardon for every immoral act you have ever committed in the United States. Just like in '97. Remember New York, Plissken?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looks at him) Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the President, for Christ's sake!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I give you my word. Put the prototype into my hands, and you're a free man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see you're real concerned about your daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Utopia is lost to me. My daughter is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'll think it over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're running out of time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been doin' that all my life. Might as well do it in L.A. Everybody else there is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, enjoy it, war hero, cause you got 10 hours to live. Malloy, Brazen, and the President turn to leave...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute, what are you talkin' about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Having second thoughts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe. But you're not putting any shit in me this time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't understand. It's already in you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As an image of the cigarette girl in New Las Vegas flashes suddenly. Her fingernail scratches his arm. He tightens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cigarette girl in New Vegas was an undercover cop. She injected you with incentive toxin. Right now it's swimming in your bloodstream. It'll start to take effect in 9 hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a strain of the Plutoxin 7 virus. Genetically engineered. 100% pure death. Complete nervous system shutdown. You crash and bleed out like a stuck pig. Not a pretty sight. Plissken takes a step toward him. Malloy holds up a large hypodermic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course there's an anti-toxin. Neutralizes the virus immediately upon injection. (beat) We'll give it to you, but you have to do us this little favor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... ...and then Plissken attacks the President, hurls himself across the room, throwing the chain around the President's neck... Plissken passes right through the President, causing his image to waver slightly, then falls on his ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't think we were that stupid, did you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The real Malloy, Brazen, and President stand in front of a laser camera in a small room offering a view of the cell through a transparent portion of the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're holographs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken stares at the three images in front of him, then at the camera lens on the wall...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get this crap out of me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess we have a deal. Nice to be working with you, Plissken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) Call me Snake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken checks through various tactical survival items and weapons laid out on a table. Brazen watches as Malloy show shim a high tech submachine gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very sweet little weapon. Core burner. Magnesium ammo. 500 extra rounds. (moves on) Two 9mm handguns. (holds up a silver pill) Oral projectile. Mouth dart. Hold it in your mouth for ten seconds, the coating dissolves, it becomes a weapon. Malloy breaks open the silver pill. Inside is s small, lethal looking dart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Urolite. It'll stun the enemy for several seconds. Plissken picks up a small, computerized compass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracer. Utopia has a kidnap chip implanted in her arm. You can locate her with this. Brazen hands Plissken a large black clip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This clips right onto your 9mm. Ammo enhancers. Like miniaturized grenades. Blows through anything. Plissken snaps the clip onto his pistol, then unsnaps it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken suits up. Submachine gun, handguns, six-guns. He, Brazen and Malloy walk quickly across the complex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .A. is in a constant state of warfare. Gangs fighting for the right to rule.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heavy Third World connections. They get weapons, drugs, fuel, choppers - everything is pumped into the island from the south.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some areas have power - they're on line to San Onofre.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Brazen's command helicopter takes off...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken stares at a photo of the anodized prototype.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll need to know more about this thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only a handful of people are aware of its existence. Let's just say it's the ultimate defensive weapon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Defense against what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a war about to be declared, or didn't you know? Plissken shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Third World wants to live like we do - and they plan on taking what they want. The Cubans and Brazilians are ready to invade Miami. If the Africans and Colombians make a run at the border, we got a full scale attack on the United States.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what does this thing do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All you need to know is get it back here by 5 a.m.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Command helicopter lands near a large access tunnel inside the containment wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken, Brazen and Malloy walk through the dark, dank tunnel. Armed guards stand at the ready. A hatch in the tunnel floor stands open. A ladder disappears down into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (points to the open hatch) You're going over by submarine. One-man submersible. Nuclear powered. Plissken arranges his gear, climbs into the hatch opening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do I put ashore?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cahuenga Pass. Make your way up through the mountains toward the Hollywood Bowl. You should be able to pick up Utopia's tracer there. (beat) Once you go inside, you're on your own. (beat) You know what you have to do with the girl, don't you? (beat) We have to spare this nation her trial - for treason.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you want me to take her out? (Malloy nods) Is that an order from the President?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's just say it's what's best for the country.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the way - who gives me the anti-toxin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A medical team will be standing by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! He fires, ripping hellish blasts at Malloy. There's no damage. Malloy laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thought you might try that. First clip is filled with blanks. Goodbye, Plissken. Malloy kicks the hatch and it slams down on top of Plissken. Brazen pushes a control button, sealing it shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken climbs down the ladder into a small submarine bay. Below him on a launching rig is a sleek, black one-man submarine shaped like a dart. The submarine's hatch is open. Plissken climbs inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken seals the hatch behind him. He has to lie flat on his stomach to operate the sub. He quickly hits various switches and buttons, powering up the cockpit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Malloy and Brazen move to a surveillance-command post.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O. RADIO) Com check. Malloy picks up the microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here, Plissken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken looks at the wrist watch. It ticks down ominously. Eight hours and counting down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Stand by for launch. Ignitor. (Plissken pushes a button) Fuel rod injection. Plissken pulls a lever, watches his dials. A deep humming sound grows louder inside the sub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's in the green.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Lock fuel rods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hits a switch) Locked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Nuclear turbine to 75% power. Plissken turns a throttle-like control with his left hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of the rear tubes of Plissken's sub comes a roaring blue glow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: % power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Hands on switches and counting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rear tubes roar. Suddenly the sub is shot forward through a long, circular tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken braces himself as the cabin lurches, vibrates with the force.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A door in the wall opens, revealing the circulator tunnel. In a roaring explosion, the sub rockets out of the tunnel, shot from the wall like a cannonball. The submarine is airborne for several seconds, then drops down, and slams into the San Fernando Sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken is rocked with the impact. He guides the sub with hand controls. In front of him on a screen is a schematic diagram of the underwater landscape of the San Fernando Valley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UNDERWATER - 405 FREEWAY - NIGHT In the underwater darkness, see the broken remains of the 405 Freeway, as the subs creams past, its nuclear wake churning in the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Malloy, Brazen and other cops follow Plissken's course on a gigantic computer screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken, watch your speed. Lots of obstructions down there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UNDERWATER - VAN NUYS CITY HALL - NIGHT As the sub rockets past the ruins of the Van Nuys City Hall, barely missing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Plissken... Plissken ignores him, carefully maneuvering the sub with his controls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Plissken... do you copy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UNDERWATER - THE VENTURA FREEWAY - NIGHT Camera follows the sub as it streaks along just above the submerged ruins of the Ventura Freeway. See the ghostly shapes of cars, trucks, busses below, smashed and overturned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They watch the sub, a red blip on the screen, move along the freeway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken twists his hand throttle, pouring on the power to 90%.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & HOLLYWOOD FREEWAY INTERCHANGE - UNDERWATER - NIGHT The sub rips through the water, faster and faster, goes into a hard bank to the right as the Ventura Freeway turns into the Hollywood. A sign at the edge of the Hollywood Freeway reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The sub screams past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brazen points to a readout showing the submarine's engine status.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His reactor's starting to overheat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken, slow down the sub. You're overloading the power plant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken glances at the gauge. His nuclear turbine readout: green, moving to yellow, into red. He pushes it up to 102%.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Plissken...? Plissken's eye turns back to the computer map in front of him. One the screen: the red blip representing the sub is headed right toward a building. Plissken pulls hard on the controls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UNDERWATER - UNIVERSAL CITY - THE BLACK TOWER - NIGHT The sub smacks into the side of the Black Tower, powers through it, blasts out the other side through a window, tilting and wobbling. The sub rights itself momentarily but is slammed downward out of frame by a huge, dark, slimy object.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looms overhead - his fist rising and falling with the currents. Plissken has maneuvered himself into the wreckage of the Universal Studios Tour. The sub zips through the King Kong ride into Back To The Future, passing 1950's signage from that film, dodging a rusting Delorean. It slams into the open mouth of JAWS, shattering the model into a million pieces. The sub continues on, bouncing through the narrow openings of the Earthquake Ride - broken pipes, cracked sidewalks, split walls - hard to tell what was the ride and what was The Big One.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken hangs on, as small jets of water spray into the cockpit through tiny cracks in the hull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UNDERWATER - MOVING WITH THE SUBMARINE - NIGHT The sub suddenly tips upward, rising for the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sub explodes out of the water, lands belly first on a hillside with a hard thump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken presses the hatch controls. The sub begins to slide backwards down toward the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken struggles, then rips open the hatch, scrambles out. The sub slowly slips backwards, down into the water. As the rear exhaust tubes hit the surface, a blast of steam. Plissken leaps out of the hatch. The sub sinks faster and faster. He scampers up the side, leaps for ground... and lands on the hillside, as the sub sinks into the sea, bubbling, churning, hissing. A bleeping sound. He takes out his pocket walkie, raises the antenna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Plissken...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Where's the submarine? It's disappeared off our screens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's history. I gotta go. Plissken clicks off the walkie, pockets it, turns to climb up the hillside when...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Standing above him is a dark figure. Hooded. Carrying something huge and rounded at the ends. Plissken raises his submachine gun... ... as PIPELINE steps closer. He's a surfer in a black wetsuit. Carries a surfboard. A rifle is slung across his shoulder. Pipeline's face is raw, burned - too many hours surfing in the UV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too bad about your boat, man. (Plissken doesn't move) Supposed to be some swells out here tonight. Big ones. (beat) You like to surf? Realizing Pipeline is no danger, Plissken moves past him up the hillside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look kinda familiar. (beat) You hang out around here much? But Plissken's moved off into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - RAIN Plissken reaches old Mulholland Drive, now dark and desolate. Shells of houses stand nearby, black and empty. It has begun to rain. The sound of gunfire. Plissken ducks behind a tree... Two old cars come zooming up Mulholland, side by side. Windows down. Guns blazing at each other. They pass Plissken, continue down Mulholland, ripping each other apart with gunfire. Plissken darts across Mulholland, down the mountainside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - RAIN The rain pours down as Plissken makes his way down a steep incline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A dark figure steps out from behind a tree. Plissken spins, submachine gun ready. It's Pipeline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, man. I know who you are. You're Snake Plissken. Man, I can't believe you're really here. More gunfire from above on Mulholland...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kind of a bad neighborhood, Snake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which way to the Hollywood Bowl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (points) Down that way. Plissken starts down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be careful. Some real strange dudes hangin' out there these days. Plissken continues moving, now just a blurry figure in the rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Snake - what're you doin' around here, man? (as Plissken disappears) I heard they busted you up real good in Cleveland...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - RAIN The rain is coming down in a torrent as Plissken makes his way down the hillside. Then, all at once, the rain lets up, then stops. The trees drip with moisture. Suddenly, a huge KATHUMP from above him. Plissken looks back. A huge mudslide is roaring its way down the hill toward him. Plissken races down the hill, but the mudslide cascades downward like a freight train, catches up with him, sweeps him off his feet... and Plissken goes riding down the hill, rumbling and sliding in the mud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mudslide hits a flat area near a stand of trees, spreads out, slows. A completely mud-covered, black Plissken climbs out of the goo. He's dripping with it. His one good eye shines in the moonlight. He takes a couple steps toward the edge of the treeline when...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Shut-up, fuck! Stop makin' noise! Plissken spins. He's standing right next to SPINAL, the leader of the Black Cowboy Gang. Dressed in black, boots with spurs, black duster, black cowboy hat, he carries an automatic rifle. He looks just like Charles Barkley. Plissken looks around, realizes he's in the middle of a small army of Black Cowboys, crouched behind the trees, waiting in ambush. Covered with mud, Plissken blends right in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take cover, fool. Plissken jumps behind a tree, looks down the hillside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Below his position is the Hollywood Bowl. A huge cross is on stage, and the cross is on fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R - HOLLYWOOD BOWL A group of white hooded men, the K.K.K., stand in front of the burning cross holding a ceremony. Next to the cross on stage, a hooded K.K.K. string quartet begins playing a Hayden concerto. Plissken reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's take him. A Black Cowboy raises his M79 grenade launcher, as the others quickly race down the hillside. He fires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 40mm armor-piercing grenade leaves a blazing fire trail as it rockets toward the burning cross and - KABLAMMO! A fireball blows pieces of the cross into the air. The K.K.K. spin around... A blast of lightning illuminates the Black Cowboys attacking from the hills. They open fire. A K.K.K. Grand Dragon is picked off his feet, buffeted in mid-air, flesh and robe shredded by gunfire. A hail of bullets hits the K.K.K. They return fire, but are overwhelmed. They are hit, jerking and twisting. Fire from the Black Cowboys is withering, racking the hooded figures like bolts of lightning. The Black Cowboys keep advancing, firing, as it starts to rain again. Through the cloudy wash of dribbling rain water, the firefight continues. Four K.K.K. leap out from behind a row of seats and jump Plissken, knocking his gun to the ground. In a blinding flash, using hands, feet, and head, Plissken sends them flying. As he reaches down to pick up his submachine gun, he sees that the rain is washing the mud off his body...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who stands nearby, watching as Plissken is washed clean by the rain. Spinal raises his weapon, then stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. I know you. Snake Plissken. Plissken slowly stands, his submachine gun in his hand. Behind them, the firefight is almost over. The K.K.K. scatter into the rain...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, what's going down, Snake?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking for somebody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who ain't? Plissken pulls out his tracer. It is blipping red, just south of the Bowl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, is it true what they say about Cleveland, man? Plissken doesn't answer. He moves on through the rain...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Later, Snake. Thanks for the help. You can always shift down and mojo with us anytime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ruins of the Capital Records building. The rain has stopped again. Plissken is a lone figure walking along the street. In the distance, the sound of thumping music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pandemonium! Music blares. It's the old Supremes hit, "Love is Like An Itchin' In My Heart." Crowds dance in the street. It's like a block party. Black, Latino and Native American gangs celebrate. Plus the usual Hollywood Boulevard street traffic. Plissken moves through the carnival. Gorgeous hookers stand under the marquee of the ruined Chinese Theater. The marquee now reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the hookers struts in front of Plissken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Opening her mouth, she gives a sensuous puff. A polypropylene orifice attached to the inside of her lips expands outward like a small, pink balloon. She sucks it back in and puckers, kissing the air. Plissken turns, as the sounds of car engines rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... is a caravan of vehicles. The crowd parts to let them through, cheering insanely. Plissken ducks into an alley, watches... The caravan passes Plissken's position. Two men on horseback lead a convoy of rumbling, fuming old cars, buses, motorcycles - all scarred and ripped and jerry-rigged - bumps down the Boulevard. Plissken watches from his spot in the alley, as a blonde-haired hooker joins him, rubs his arm. She has no polypropylene, at least none that we can see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's winnin' time, baby. How about you and I do some celebrating?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be new around here. (beat) You look familiar. Have I done you before? Plissken grabs the hooker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, man, easy. It's Cuervo Jones' gang. Mescalito Justice. He's the big boss man 'round here tonight. (whispers) He's gonna take down the police and make 'em kiss his fine ass. Plissken lets her go, stares...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... is perched ten feet off the ground on monster truck wheels. Severed doll heads are glued all over the hood, and a large glittering disco ball spins atop the roof, catching shards of light and flicking them back into the night... Behind the disco ball stands the real Cuervo Jones, at least. And there next to him is Utopia. She's dressed in black lace underwear and bra, garters and stockings. A Playboy fantasy. She holds the prototype. Delgado, Cuervo Jones' second-in-command, stands behind her. He is huge and evil. Dressed like Pancho Villa. Plissken stares as the Cadillac passes. The hooker cheers along with the rest of the crowd, and doesn't notice that Plissken's moved off... Several motorcycles bring up the rear of the caravan. Mescalitos ride with their women slung behind them. As the last bike passes, Plissken darts out of the alley, yanks the woman off the back of the cycle, jumps on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mescalito biker turns to react...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Plissken takes him out with a head-butt, shoves him off the bike, hops up on the seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Plissken guns the motorcycle and it roars off, around the other bikers, toward the head of the caravan. Plissken zooms along, makes the turn onto La Brea Avenue with the caravan...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the caravan turns west onto Sunset, Plissken blasts around the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming right behind him are four Mescalitos on Harleys - chains, iron bars, and swords in their hands. Plissken stares up ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... is just a few feet away. Cuervo Jones and Utopia. Plissken guns it when suddenly two Mescalitos pull up on either side of him. One of them swings a chain. Plissken grabs it with one hand, and with his other hand, aims his submachine gun and fires! The Mescalito and bike go flying, and Plissken holds on to the chain. Atop the Cadillac, Cuervo Jones reacts to the sound of gunfire. He turns to see...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the other Mescalito riding behind him swings a chain. Plissken swings his. The two chains snap together, intertwining. Then Plissken squeezes his hand-brake. He screeches to a stop. The Mescalito keeps going, and is yanked over backward by his own chain, off the Harley. Finally the Harley flops over, skids, explodes. Plissken guns it again, takes off after the Cadillac. Two more Mescalitos pull up on either side of Plissken. They take aim at him with their automatic rifles. Plissken pulls a sudden wheelie, lifts the front of his bike up into the air, rides on the back wheel. The two Mescalitos fire - directly into each other. They fall and their bikes go crashing to the pavement. Plissken surges the bike forward, coming up on a Mescalito on horseback who turns and fires. Plissken ducks and the bullet rips through the rear tire. The tire blows and the bike swerves out of control. Plissken leaps from the bike and grabs the back of the saddle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken pulls himself up behind the Mescalito and wrestles for control of the mount. Plissken grabs the reins and wraps them around the Mescalito's neck, squeezing until his eyes burst. Plissken slams his arm against the Mescalito, throwing him off the saddle, bouncing onto the pavement. Plissken gallops ahead, circling a lasso high above his head, pounding down on a biker. The lasso takes flight and finds it mark, the biker's neck. Plissken pulls the lasso taut, ties the end to the saddle horn, rides his mount parallel to the biker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With one quick yank to the lasso, Plissken pulls the biker off, jumps on the bike and smacks the hell out of the horse's rump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Takes off down the street, dragging the biker by the neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speeds up as Plissken moves up to the Mustang five cars behind. He swings off the bike and jumps onto the trunk. Plissken climbs up to the roof, leaps on the hood, then jumps to the trunk of the car in front - leapfrogging, jumping to the next car, the next car...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lean out their car windows, firing at him, but Plissken keeps moving toward the Cadillac...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reaches out a car window and grabs Plissken's submachine gun. Plissken turns to snatch it back -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leaps from the Cadillac and takes Plissken down to the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snake Plissken. They struggle. Cuervo raises his machete. Plissken grabs his wrist, flips him over, knocks the machete off into the street, smacks Cuervo in the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comes roaring up on his bike, throws the bolas...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the bolas hit him, wrap around his neck, the balls thunking him in the face, sending him flying...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Plissken hits the pavement hard. He skids, rolls, and at last slams into the edge of the sidewalk. The caravan rumbles away down Sunset. The hand in the car window still holds Plissken's submachine gun. Cuervo crouches on the roof, hissing at Plissken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Later, Snake. We finish it later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lies there for several beats, then climbs to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... disappears up Sunset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stands alone in the deserted street. The ruins of a supermarket, cheap motels, liquor stores - all empty, desolate. He looks over to see the broken remains of his pocket walkie. After a beat, he starts moving up Sunset, checking his two 9mm handguns, slipping them into their holsters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the border of Beverly Hills, Sunset stretches off into the darkness beyond the intersection. A slight wind blows litter aimlessly along. There are occasional sounds: Creaks, distant clangs. Plissken approaches the intersection. He carries Utopia's compass homing device. It is silent. The small screen's blank. Then Plissken glances at his wrist watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three hours gone. Plissken stands for a moment, staring off down Sunset...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Snake Plissken, right? He spins around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sits in an old beach chair on the sidewalk, a map to the stars sign in front of him. In his late 50's, he's a petty thief, con man. He's been hustling tourists and everybody else all his life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow! Snake Plissken! Map To The Stars Eddie listens to WAYWARD WIND by Gogi Grant on a small, metal-plated portable radio. He clicks off the radio, rises, walks over to Plissken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a star in your own right, you know that? Hey, I'm Map To The Stars Eddie. How you doin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd they go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, I'd love to have your autograph, Snake. He searches around in his pockets, comes up with pen and paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been hearing about you ever since that New York deal back in the 90's. You're one smooth operator. (offers pen and paper) Could you sign one to Wolf, one to Death's Head, one to Slasher Smith...? Plissken grabs him by the throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who? You mean Cuervo Jones? He's the man with the juice, Snake. Got the President's daughter. Setting up a citywide truce. Big doings. Plissken draws a 9mm and points it at Map To The Stars Eddie's forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Location.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cuervo's got a place near Venice, where the big birds fly. Nice digs, too. I've been there, y'know. Plissken releases him, as suddenly the tracer beeps. On the device Plissken sees a small red pulsing dot. West.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice little gizmo you got there. (whispers conspiratorially) Look, Snake. I've got connections in this town. You need something, I'm your man. Without a word Plissken turns, walks away down Sunset Boulevard toward Beverly Hills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey - you can't go there, Snake. You can't walk through Beverly Hills. Plissken's figure disappears...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUNSET - SIGN - NIGHT The old Beverly Hills sign. It's been painted over in dripping red letters: "QUIET - SURGICAL ZONE - STAY OUT" Plissken ignores the sign, keeps walking down a completely dark Sunset Boulevard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken walks past the once-beautiful mansions along Sunset. Now they are dark, ruined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R - BEVERLY HILLS MANSION As a twisted, mechanical hand sewn awkwardly to the flesh of the wrist pulls aside a window curtain. The face behind the window is in shadows, but we can just make out its pale, discolored features. The other hand brings up a walkie-talkie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into walkie) Specimen moving west on Sunset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken moves into the intersection of Sunset and Beverly Drive. The ruins of the old Beverly Hills Hotel are ahead and to his right. He stops, stares down Sunset...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emerges from the shadows. This is the gatekeeper. Strange, mismatched body parts. A black-skinned arm attached to a pale white body. His face is unnaturally smooth - too many face lifts. He carries a torch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Halt! (beat) Where are you going? (no reply) Are you here for the auction?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Figures have suddenly moved out into the street, all with mismatched body parts - heads too large for their torsos, female body parts mixed with male heads, all sewn together with large, uneven stitches. Plissken is surrounded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome to Beverly Hills. Plissken raises his gun, starts to move, when suddenly a figure rises behind him out of the shadows...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raises a lead pipe, brings it down hard...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! He goes out like a light. As Plissken slumps unconscious to the street, the figures move for him. Their arms lock around him, drag him away with amazing speed - a pack of wolves on a deer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken bolts awake, to find himself tied to a cross. It's lurching back and forth as though the ground is moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken is being carried down Rodeo Driveon the cross by a throng of surgical failures. They carry torches. Dressed in tatters. Their faces look only partially human sewn together raggedly. Rodeo Drive is a bizarre marketplace of body parts. The once beautiful storefronts of famous designers are now in shambles. Human body parts are on display like filets of fish on ice. Gucci now offers body pieces fashioned from spare car parts and Armani displays more eclectic, high priced pieces sewn together like sculptures in their windowfronts. A giant rift runs down the street's center. Acrid smoke rises. The throng stops at an intersection, and Plissken's cross is anchored in the middle of the street. Surrounding the intersection are patients of every size, age, sex. Plissken looks over, sees another cross being carried up and planted right next to his. A beautiful girl is tied to this cross. This is TASLIMA, 20's, Iranian, the face of a Persian princess. She's dressed in black leather, and basically has an IQ of around
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Snake. It's so great to meet you. My name's Taslima. I'm a fan of yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you crazy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little bit. But pretty soon I'm gonna be dead. So are you, Snake. Plissken looks across the street. Our of the ruins of the once famous red door of Elizabeth Arden come an arm of women facialists with acid-burned faces from one-too-many skin peelings wielding knives, saws, horrible-looking carving instruments...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe I got caught. (sighs) I run with Midnight Jihad. Iranian gang. Only they kicked me out, cause I screw up sometimes. I forget stuff. Plissken struggles with his bonds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I left my boyfriend's place tonight, took a wrong turn... (sighs again) Oh, Snake, I'm really kind of out of it sometimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: come more interns and nurses carrying surgical pans and pushing gurneys to collect dismembered body parts. The throng of facialists, patients, interns and nurses surround Plissken and Taslima on the crosses. They move back to the sidewalks as the auction for body parts cut freshly from Plissken and Taslima is about to begin. The gurneys are wheeled into place and set up as large cutting tables. The facialists take their positions behind the tables waiting to carve fresh meat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They live here, used to be like us. But after too many silicon implants, their muscles turned to jelly. The only way they survive is to have body parts transplanted over and over again. (whispers) Snake, nobody who comes into Beverly Hills gets out alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No screamin' shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no, it's the Doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Surgeon General of Beverly Hills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steps out into the street. He appears incredibly gorgeous, a hunk of a man, put together by the finest body parts available in Beverly Hills - a millennium Fabio - but upon closer examination, he's got no lower jaw. Instead, there is a rusting metal grid-work attached beneath each ear. It never moves. He can actually speak through a metal box attached to his windpipe.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE DOCTOR, THE SURGEON GENERAL OF BEVERLY HILLS

direction.raw_text: Stands in front of them. He raises his hands to quiet the crowd. He walks around the cross, admiring the beautiful bodies before him. He tickles the fine flesh with his right hand, which is made up of 10 gleaming scalpels which form a 360 degree cutting edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never seen more beautiful specimens. There will be no auction tonight. These body parts will go to those who need them the most. The crowd gumbles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turns his head sideways, to a small hidden pocket near his neck. With his teeth, he pulls out the silver mouth dart, slips it onto his tongue, closes his mouth. The doctor raises his gleaming scalpel hand and steps toward Plissken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a beautiful blue eye. It's a shame you only have one. A nurse brings over a small step-ladder. The doctor positions it in front of Plissken, slowly climbs up the rungs until he is face to face with him. The doctor looks ready to pluck Plissken's good eye from its socket with his scalpel tips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Plissken spits the mouth dart!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The dark hits the doctor squarely in the forehead. He freezes, his scalpel hand raised, his eyes clouding. He falls forward. The scalpel hand swings, misses its mark, and instead hits the rope tied around Plissken's wrist. WHATCK! The rope's cut! Plissken grabs the scalpel hand with his free hand, cuts his other hand and legs loose in a flash and pushes the doctor backward off the step-ladder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Plissken falls to the intersection, almost at the same time as the doctor hits the pavement. The patients are stunned. Motionless. They stare at their doctor lying in the street, moaning, moving slightly. Snake starts to run...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snake, help me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Almost on a whim, Plissken cuts her free. Then he runs. Taslima follows him. Plissken heads toward a side street, looks over his shoulder, sees Taslima following...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't follow me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like hell I do. Then Plissken comes to a dead stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comes a mass of patients right at him. Taslima grabs Plissken, pulls him with her. They take off down a dark cobblestone street...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken and Taslima run as behind them the patient horde gives chase. They stop at another small alley between two large buildings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Down this way. They disappear into the small alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's long and narrow and completely enclosed by the buildings on either side. Suddenly Plissken and Taslima come to the end - a 75 foot high four-story building blocking the passageway to Wilshire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a dead end. (looks at her) You took us into a dead end!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just thought you wanted to get away. I didn't know you wanted to go someplace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! They turn... The doctor staggers down the alley, the dart still sticking from his forehead. Behind him, the patients follow... Plissken shoves Taslima toward a broken window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go! He follows Taslima through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken and Taslima climb dilapidated stairs, move along the balcony railing. A torn and tattered Roy Lichtenstein painting hangs crooked on a wall. Twenty foot high bright red letters -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - lie strewn across the marble floor. Various offices are wrecked and dark, scripts lay all over the place. They stop at a dark hallway. Taslima moves cautiously ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be careful of the bald cats. They live in these buildings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The what? Plissken reaches for his other 9mm in its holder, but his hands are trapped by the doctor's body. Closer and closer moves the claw dagger toward Plissken's good eye. Taslima scrambles, picks up Plissken's 9mm, then stares at the two men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yelling) Are you gonna stand there? Give me the gun! Taslima starts to hand it to him. Both Plissken and the doctor fight to reach it. Finally, it's in Plissken's grasp. He blasts three times - each one hitting. The doctor shudders, rolls away. Plissken gets to his feet. He blasts one more time for good measure, then follows Taslima down the hallway...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They come down a flight of stairs, stop at the rear door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do we get out of here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sewers. Come on. She pushes open the door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken and Taslima run from the building, as a chorus of wails rises. Patients swarm around the building in pursuit. Taslima stops at a sewer grate in the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Down there. Plissken lifts the grating. Taslima jumps in, followed by Plissken...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dim, greenish light. Plissken and Taslima begin running down the sewer tunnel. Through the hole behind them drop patients, giving chase. Plissken and Taslima race through a half-filled storm drain seeping with slime. They turn a corner into another tunnel, and run smack into a horde of patients. Instantly, the patients overpower them. Hands reach out and drag them down... Suddenly, from down the tunnel comes an unearthly sound, a weird whispery screech like a demon unleashed from the underworld. It gets louder and louder. The patients freeze, then begin screaming and, as the sound gets louder still, they all disappear, escaping back down the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An eerie light appears, coming nearer and nearer every moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snake - what is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the hell am I supposed to know? This is your damn city. Slowly, the light takes form. It is a single, gigantic eye - floating in pitch-black darkness. It continues coming - growing larger and larger. Suddenly the sewer begins to echo with a blasting, ringing sound. Music! It's incredibly LOUD SALSA MUSIC! From out of the tunnel drives an ancient golf cart. On a metal pole in front is a huge, lighted eye such as an optometrist might use to advertise his services. Salsa music blares at top volume from loudspeakers strapped to the sides of the cart. At the wheel of the vehicle is a large man dressed in jeans, cowboy boots and a flak vest, wearing a gas mask. A lariat is hooked to his belt. He pulls up near Plissken and Taslima, shuts off the motor and the music, lifts a shotgun from the seat beside him, climbs down. He holds the gun on them. Removing his head gear, his face becomes visible. He is PENDEJO BOB, a Mexican wearing sunglasses under the gas mask. He takes off the sunglasses, and his apparently blind in one eye. He looks like Los Lobos' lead guitarist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you doing in here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking to get out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. I want you out. This is my sewer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which way? With a grunt of curiosity, Pendejo Bob moves up to Plissken. Suddenly his blind eye flashes on like a tiny, built-in spotlight. With it, he examines Plissken's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're Snake Plissken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Isn't he cool? There is a clicking sound and the lighted eye is extinguished. Pendejo Bob extends his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An honor, Snake. Amigo. They call me Pendejo Bob. Plissken doesn't shake. From down the tunnel the shouts and footfalls of the patients gets closer...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those damn patients are coming back. You'd better climb aboard. Plissken and Taslima climb into the rear of the golf cart. Pendejo Bob spins the cart, takes off in the other direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The golf cart streaks along through a dark sewer passage. The only light comes from the eye on the front of the vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I use the eye and the music to scare em off. They're so whacked out, man, it works great. Chased a whole bunch of em right off the edge there a few months ago. He points to a sheer, pitch-black drop-off on one side of the passage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (she peers over the side) How far down does it go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know - never do hear em land. Earthquake opened it up. The golf cart creaks into a narrow tunnel...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guards, Hispanics in biker denims, fatigues, with rifles and sunglasses, line the walls. They watch as the golf cart passes. Up ahead is a door marked: "SEWAGE RECLAMATION CONTROL" INT. SEWER RECLAMATION CENTER - CONTROL ROOM - NIGHT The cart pulls into the remains of a mammoth underground control center. It's lined with ladders, catwalks, machines full of gauges and levers. A few are still working - most are broken and covered with dust and grime. Filling the room is an underground enclave: Men, women, children, all Hispanic, living in tents and lean-to's, cooking over open fires next to old rusted cars on blocks, lots of weapons, lots of sunglasses. Also, high-tech, futuristic rifles, cannons, grenade launchers - an amazing arsenal. Crates of explosives are stacked everywhere. The golf cart comes to a stop and they get off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I own this whole place. Used to work here in the old days. I was right in this room when the big one hit. What a mess. We were waist high in shit. (turns proudly to them) Everybody else ran, but not me. I stayed at my post. Now it's all mine. I brought my whole family, my amigos, down here to live with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gun runners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, it's a living, baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you get out of L.A.? Take a boat to China, take an airplane to Brazil? (looks at Taslima) Earthquakes, death, shit. Why do you stay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Somehow, I just can't leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'know, L.A.'s not such a bad place, Snake. We got our problems, sure - but this is paradise, man. Pendejo Bob leans in close and whispers conspiratorially to Plissken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, you need anything, Snake? Guns? Explosives? I can get you a crate of hellfire grenades, no problem - five hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. So how do I get to Venice?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All the sewers are collapsed under Venice. You have to go topside. Right up there. He leads Plissken and Taslima to a ladder that goes up into the darkness. A line of men steadily climb up, one after the other, carrying crates of weapons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comes out near the Santa Monica Freeway. Just follow the signs. Get off at the Lincoln Exit, turn left. Pendejo Bob interrupts the line of men. Plissken starts up the ladder, followed by Taslima...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to meet you, Snake. You too, Miss. You're welcome down here anytime. Anytime at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plissken, gun in hand, sticks his head out of the open grate. Taslima follows. The Hispanic men who have climbed up out of the sewers load their weapons crates into various low-rider cars in heavily-armed groups. They rumble off into the night. Taslima points to a freeway on-ramp.
direction.name: direction

location: STREET UNDER SANTA MONICA FREEWAY OVERPASS
result.heading: EXT.

direction.raw_text: The freeway's over there. But, Snake - I don't think it's such a good idea. Plissken starts toward the on-ramp. Taslima doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The freeways are dangerous. He keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye, Snake. Plissken stops, turns back, looks at her - a half-smile. It's as close to 'thank you' as he gets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sun's coming up in a few hours. She walks up to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UV's gonna be bad today. I have a friend who's got a place near here. We can crash there if you want, Snake. (she moves close to him) I'd love to take care of you. Make you feel good. Without an answer Plissken turns and walks away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As far as the eye can see there are lines of rusting cars and trucks, bumper to bumper like a giant junkyard rush hour. Plissken walks up the on-ramp, onto the freeway. He strides past rows of junked cars. A few of them have people inside... There is a Mercedes rusted to its frame, its driver an 80-year-old in sunglasses, drinking from a bottle. A pickup truck full of old illegal aliens packed in like sardines. Someone cooks from a barbecue grill. An RV. An old man sits in the opened doorway, staring at Plissken as he passes. Two old ladies in housecoats stare at him through the windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A sound behind Plissken. He spins, 9mm ready... It's Taslima, running to catch up with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I changed my mind. I'm going with you, wherever you're going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gestures to the cars) What the hell is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The freeway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that. There are people in some of these cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's where they live. I guess after everything happened, they just needed to do what they'd always done before. During the daytime, they just pull down the shades on their windows and sleep. Plissken continues walking. Taslima catches up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you gonna do in Venice?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find Cuervo Jones.
direction.name: direction
